select.label: If any support was lost or reduced, what were the main reasons? (Tick up to 3)

item.label: Service discontinued (e.g., program ended, no longer offered)
Staff shortages (e.g., fewer CHWs, nurses, social workers)
Safety concerns (e.g., unsafe travel routes, violence)
Stigma or discrimination (e.g., fear of judgment, exclusion)
Didn't know where to go or who to ask
No transport / too far / too costly
Lack of required documents (e.g., ID, proof of address)
Timing issues (e.g., clinic hours, long queues, conflicting responsibilities)
Support only available to certain groups or connected people (e.g., not open to everyone)

select.label: How did the loss or reduction affect your household? (Tick up to 2)

item.label: Had to borrow money or food
Relied more on neighbours or informal help
Lost trust in health or social services
Had to rely on informal/unsafe alternatives
Had to rely on private and expensive alternatives

select1.label: In the last 3 months, did your household receive any food support?

select.label: If yes, where did the food support come from? (Tick all that apply)
For each source of food support, did it help in any of the following ways listed in the table below? (Tick all that apply per row)

item.label: Made it easier or more comfortable to seek help (e.g., clinic, CHW, social worker)
Led to contact with a CHW, clinic, or other health service
Led to contact with a social worker, grant office, or other non-clinical support service
Helped you feel more supported or part of a caring community

select1.label: Overall, did receiving food support make you feel more or less comfortable asking for other help (e.g., Did you feel more likely to engage with CHWs or clinics)?

input.label: How long does it usually take to travel one-way to your usual clinic or medicine pick-up point?
To what extent does it cost, a return trip to the clinic from the pick-up point?

select1.label: In the past 6 months, did you delay or avoid a clinic visit due to safety concerns or time constraints?
If Yes, what was the main reason?

item.label: Unsafe area or route (e.g., gang activity, poor lighting, harassment risk)
Time of day (e.g., too early, too late, unsafe hours)
Caregiving or work responsibilities made it hard to go

select1.label: In the past 14 days, did you turn back on the way to a clinic or pharmacy because it felt unsafe?
Thinking about your last interaction with a healthcare provider or CHW, how much do you agree with the following statements? (Tick one in the table below per row)
Was your issue or need addressed during that interaction?

item.label: Yes, fully: The health worker listened, responded appropriately, and the issue was resolved without needing further follow-up.
Partly: Some help was given, but the issue was not fully resolved, or the response felt incomplete.
No: The issue was not addressed, or the interaction left the respondent feeling dismissed, unheard, or unsupported.
Not applicable / Can't recall: The respondent does not remember the interaction clearly or did not raise an issue.

select1.label: How much do you trust health workers at your local clinic to do their best to help you and the community?

item.label: Complete trust: I believe they consistently act in the best interest of patients and the community, even under pressure.
Mostly: I generally trust them, but there are occasional concerns or inconsistencies.
Unsure: I'm not certain; I've had mixed experiences or limited contact.
Not much: I often feel they don't listen, follow through, or treat people fairly.
No trust: I do not believe they act in the community's best interest or treat people with respect.

select1.label: In the past 12 months, did you have an opportunity to give input on clinic services (meeting, WhatsApp, suggestion box)?
If Yes, did you receive any feedback?

select.label: When your household faces a health or social problem, how helpful are the following people or groups in the table below? (Tick how helpful they are in the columns below)

select1.label: Thinking about the last health or social problem your household faced that was actually resolved, who helped solve it? (Tick one)
In the last 90 days, did a CHW or clinic promise to do something for your household (e.g., referral, call back, document help)?
If Yes, was it completed?
Who completed it?
Did anyone inform you of the outcome?

select.label: Which long-term health conditions are present in your household? (Tick all that apply)

item.label: Cancer (ongoing care or treatment in the past 12 months)
Depression, anxiety or other ongoing mental health problem
Disability or rehabilitation need after stroke/injury

select.label: For each condition you ticked above, is anyone in the household currently on treatment/regular medicine for that condition?
In the past 6 months, did anyone in the household receive any of the following support for managing their chronic medicines? (Tick all that apply)

item.label: Peer/support group or club (e.g., adherence/collection club)

select1.label: Has anyone in the household had an HIV test in the past 12 months?

select.label: Has anyone in the household been offered HIV self-screening or testing in the past 12 months? (Tick one per row)

select1.label: Has anyone in the household been screened for TB (symptom screen or test) in the past 12 months?
Is anyone in the household currently on ART (HIV treatment) or TB Treatment?

select.label: In the past 6 months, did anyone on ART or TB treatment receive any of the following support? (Tick all that apply)
In the past 3 months, did anyone in the household miss ART or TB doses due to any of the following reasons? (Tick all that apply - limit to top 5 options)

item.label: Forgot or ran out of medication
Felt better or had side effects

select1.label: In the past 7 days, did anyone miss or delay medicine because there was no food at dose time?
Have you heard of a clinic/health committee for your local clinic?
How did you first hear about the clinic/health committee for your local clinic?
H.63 Has the clinic/health committee (or its members) ever helped you or your household with an issue?
